message: Any banter for the Ninty conference
Skyward Sword this holiday season
(You'll have to forgive me if I report news that isn't news)
This is Nintendo's unique gift: presenting awesome stuff in the most insufferably boring possible way.
Nintendo with the projected AR display awesomeness.
Classy, Nintendo
Watching on iPhone while making dinner
Orchestra = win
Oh man, the A/V show is amazing
(My iPhone is going to smell like garlic forever now)
A lesson they can learn from Apple (one of the many):
Doubt it. He specifically mentioned HD graphics.
:o
"circle pads"?
Oh this seems neat as heck.
Ben Folds? Why?
Put microphones in the crowd to record the applause
If you switch a game from the TV to the controller, is the game still running on the actual Wii-U (if such exists)?
Ahaha, lego GTA
Awesome
Arkham City!
Well that's interesting
You're a Sony mole
So help me Sony if they don't get around to Cafe before I have to go
Dawid's having to change his underwear now.
Is it bad that I'm only here for the third party games?
Haha
Er, okay. Wow, I guess?
Wheeeeeeeooooo
Guessing not
at least
It's at least 3
"Nintendo WiiU"
I'm not getting all of this
My stream cut out, so I might have missed something, but I don't quite understand how this works.
Ah, okay then.
OH MY GOD A NEW ITERATION OF POPULAR NINTENDO FRANCHISE X
Wait, is that the official Cafe name?
Uuurgh.
Ooh, pretties.
Post highlights!  I'll BBL!
Those sound like not-sticks
(Sorry.)
Is all the hardware in the portable unit?
He keeps saying new controller, and is scaring me (for Nintendo's sake) that it's just a Wii peripheral
I wish multinational corporations would stop trying to CHANGE THE WAY I PLAY GAMES
Well, time to reveal next-gen consoles and get people salivating for those, I mean
Well I was expecting the usual Nintendo "Oh, yeah, that could be cool"
OK, that's more than 1.5 GameCubes
I'm guessing they haven't nailed down the look
OK dinner time.  I'll have to catch up later…
I am so happy
It's a new console with innovative controls that can actually play good games. :D
It's best of what I've seen, but I didn't see Sony's
Man, who cares about the Wii
It's all about the Wiiyoooooooo now
You weren't?
Did I miss him showing the actual console?
Probably
At least it seems they're not holding back Skyward Sword for it
Would like to see actual specs (not that we'll get those from Big N)
Did he say "Battlefield"?
It's just it's … almost EXACTLY what I expected
I see Dragon Age, I see Mass Effect
I am really excited
Yeah?
It wasn't there
Well
Why does it seem like I'm the only one who thought that was, hands-down, the worst show of this year's E3? :)

Look, the 3DS stuff was impressive -- that's got a good lineup. But, did they announce *anything* for Wii? Like, anything at all? It is still going to be the only Nintendo home console on the market for the next year-and-a-half. EPIC FAIL, imho.
We'll have to practise saying that
I wasn't expecting this
Everybody was going on about how easy it would be to port to it from current HD consoles
But good 3rd party support would really lift it beyond previous Nintendo consoles
But I'm excited for the console
So much third party footage - am I watching the wrong presser?
If this came out at the end of this year, Sony and MS would be scrambling
As it is, 2012 — and by that I assume "holidays 2012" — gives them more than enough time…
Married with the disappointment that's been the Wii and DS
It's a screen, if all the processing is being done on the console, it can display whatevs.
You did miss all the 3rd parties looking as stunning as they do on PS3 and 360 though, I guess
Neilan, when you've played it on the show floor you can report back.
This is really exciting
But this is a console that could take the games I'm love and make them legitimately better than the PS3 and 360 counterparts in honest-to-god innovative ways.
The graphics on screen there didn't quite seem to equal 360 and PS3 quality… or was that just me?
I'm guessing that's just because they have no real software to show for it yet.
Right?
Yeah
OK, I must REALLY go eat now
Cheerio

Are developers going to make good use of it? I'm not convinced. I *like* the fact that you can play, say in bed, without needing the TV. This perhaps highlights the fundamental flaw of the cross-platform PS3/PSV functionality (*no-one* is going to buy Ruin twice). And that feature will, I think, largely discourage developers from using the dual-display features in meaningful ways.
Or did he really just … not?
THIS ISN'T RIGHT
Ok, I best be going
Frankly a proper HD platform for Nintendo's 1st party content is enough for me
Oh, look, the show itself was awful
The rumours were remarkably close to the mark… well, the ones we can judge in any way at this point
It looks way too big. I don't see how it's gonna be comfortable to play with.
Lastly, it just looks too gimmicky.
All together now
No, I really like it
They had me at the orchestra playing the Zelda medley
At first I was really disappointed, but after the 3rd party show reel it's looking alright. I'll wait and see.
"alright"
Maybe it's because I wasn't really reading up on it
Wheeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeyoooooooooooooooo
I'll have to catch up
I don't want to get carried away with possibility, but the basic selling point (to me) can be summarized as follows:
And it will have a fucking SCREEN in the controller.
Why does it seem like I'm the only one reeling from this
"at least they're not"
Yeah, they're osborning themselves a bit there
If I may though, I think Sony took this one. :o
As for the Wii U. Sure, it looks way better than the Wii, which is already much. But, man, I don't know about that controller.
Also I don't want to judge the controller until I've tried it, but I do understand the concern there.
It looks way too expensive. Am I gonna be able to afford a split-screen setup?
Maps in open world games, quick items in RPGs, inventories in FPSs - there's so much potential for third parties to enhance the games we know and love.
It can play 360/PS3 games. It will probably even look slightly better, or perform slightly faster.
Hmmm. I'm not personally convinced, but I bet this Weeeeyoooo will sell like hotcakes.

I get what you're saying, but that's just it. Do I want to play Arkham City with this giant thing in my hands? No. Have Rocksteady been developing their almost-complete game to make meaningful use of this extra screen that'll be available a year after the game hits market? No. :/
Oho: http://www.blogcdn.com/www.engadget.com/media/2011/06/11x06071813.jpg
Well let's not focus on games that are releasing soon, they probably won't be equipped to best make use of it.
If I were a betting man, I'd bet that we won't see any real innovative use of the the screen on the controller for quite some time...
"The games shown for Wii U at the show were actually PS3 and 360 versions but the Wii U will look the same or better"

"Fact sheet" of sorts:

http://www.reddit.com/r/gaming/comments/htwfy/new_nintendo_console_wii_u_fact_sheet/
http://i.imgur.com/EYoUU.png
Also, I'd love to know what Retro Studios are busy working on for that hardware

After the shock sinking in I'm going to be optimistic and call it the Dreamcast 2. Some of you who don't have wives or kids demanding the tv screen night not understand just how innovative that idea is. Also, I kinda welcome that big thing of a controller fir my big hands :) When playing Mario Kart for example (which is a bad example as you all hate it more than anything in life) on my DS I permanently use the bottom screen to check what's happening behind me, because you can zoom it in and out - that's the kind of thing that makes it logical to me.
Is that screen touch screen? Also why wait a year LONGER to play Batman on the WiiU?
DS style (not multi-touch) screen.
http://v.cdn.cad-comic.com/comics/cad-20110608-6de8c.png
Hah.

My biggest concern with the Wii U controller is how ergonomic will it be to use in extended play sessions. I could never really good used to the Wii controllers as well. I loved the old GameCube controller.
I missed large swathes of the Nintendo presser.  Did they at any point mention a release timeframe for Skyward Sword, no matter how vague?
"Holidays 2011"
Ah, good. Thanks!
